intro: Madia, commonly known as the "blueweed," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. The plants typically have hairy, branched stems and are characterized by their small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Madia species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid environments. They are also known for their aromatic foliage and are sometimes used in herbal remedies.
